core:process.core:name: Recall Transaction
core:process.core:comment: Merge items from source to target transaction. Target transaction actually must be the current transaction!

core:processNote.core:description:
At the moment, Dispatch Details items and delivery charge items are skipped.
It is possible to allow DispatchDetails Items when the target is a Sale, in which case the dispatch is brought over intact.
However this does not make the target a Dispatch Transaction.
This action can modify existing target basket items. This is not desirable and the code should be separated out.

Notes: 1. voidItem.voided is always false.
2. Need to check that voidtem is instance of com.enactor.mfc.basket.items.VoidItem explicitly as objects that implement the ISalesItem interface also implement IVoidableItem.
3. For an item that has been voided, the basket will contain a MerchandiseItem object as well as a VoidItem object so we need to decrement mergedItemCount and mergedSalesItemCount.

core:action.core:comment: Potentially skip items which shouldn't be merged.
TODO Move code out from the PrepareItem... action.

core:dataAssignment.fromExpression: voidItem != null && instanceOf(voidItem, 'com.enactor.mfc.basket.items.VoidItem') ? (mergedSalesItemCount - 1) : (targetSalesItem != null ? mergedSalesItemCount + 1 : mergedSalesItemCount)
